title: IELTS Academic Reading Test - Technology & Society
description: Full practice test with 3 passages covering technology, psychology, and history

sections.title: The Digital Revolution and Its Impact on Education
sections.passage:
The integration of digital technology into educational systems has fundamentally transformed how students learn and teachers instruct. From interactive whiteboards to comprehensive learning management systems, technology has permeated every aspect of modern education. This digital revolution has brought both unprecedented opportunities and significant challenges to educational institutions worldwide.

Research conducted by the International Society for Technology in Education indicates that students who use digital tools regularly demonstrate improved engagement and retention rates. These tools enable personalized learning experiences, allowing students to progress at their own pace and receive immediate feedback on their performance. Moreover, digital platforms facilitate collaboration among students across geographical boundaries, fostering global perspectives and cultural awareness.

However, the rapid adoption of educational technology has also raised concerns about digital equity. Not all students have equal access to devices and reliable internet connections, creating a digital divide that may exacerbate existing educational inequalities. Schools in underserved communities often struggle to provide adequate technological infrastructure, leaving their students at a disadvantage compared to their more affluent peers.

Furthermore, the effectiveness of educational technology depends heavily on how it is implemented. Simply providing devices without proper teacher training and pedagogical frameworks often yields disappointing results. Successful integration requires comprehensive professional development programs that help educators understand not just the technical aspects but also the pedagogical principles underlying effective technology use in the classroom.
